title: Sri Lanka’s Defence Forces must become one of the most professional in the world – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasised that Sri Lanka’s defence forces must be developed into one of the most professional forces in the world.

title: US imposes 50% tariff on Indian goods starting today, Modi says buy local
byline: The US has imposed a new 50% tariff on Indian-origin goods starting Wednesday, August 27.

title: Several spells of showers expected in various parts of the country today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: UN demands justice over Israeli double strike on Gaza hospital
byline: The UN has said “there needs to be justice” following Israel’s double strike on a Gaza hospital which killed at least 20 people, as an initial Israeli military probe said the strike had targeted a “camera positioned by Hamas”.

title: How to effectively communicate using Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp? State workers given training
byline: Meta launched a Digital Government Day program to upskill media secretaries and representatives of state media institutions, in partnership with the Ministry of Digital Economy and the Information and Communication Technology Agency.

title: Defence Forces must become one of the most professional in the world – President
byline: Sri Lanka’s defence forces must be developed into one of the most professional forces in the world, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasised.

title: Ex-President Ranil should undergo immediate heart surgery – Dr. Rukshan Bellana
byline: Dr Rukshan Bellana, the Deputy Director of the Colombo National Hospital says that it is appropriate to refer former President Ranil Wickremesinghe for urgent heart surgery.

title: How to effectively communicate using Facebook and WhatsApp? State workers given training
byline: Meta launched a Digital Government Day program to upskill media secretaries and representatives of state media institutions, in partnership with the Ministry of Digital Economy and the Information and Communication Technology Agency.

title: Man fatally assaulted – Navy personnel taken into custody
byline: A 59-year-old has been fatally assaulted in Makulugaswewa, Galewela, police stated.

title: Three including two school children killed in Kuliyapitiya accident
byline: A total of three persons including two children have died in a road accident in Kuliyapitiya this morning (27), police said.

title: 30 killed in landslides in India’s Jammu and Kashmir
byline: At least 30 people have lost their lives after heavy rains triggered a massive landslide near the Vaishno Devi shrine in Katra, Jammu and Kashmir in India, news agency ANI reported.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce get engaged after two-year romance
byline: Pop superstar Taylor Swift and National Football League player Travis Kelce are engaged to be married, the couple announced on social media on Tuesday.

title: Three Sri Lankans arrested at BIA with foreign cigarettes worth Rs. 45M
byline: Three Sri Lankans have been arrested at the BIA this morning while attempting to smuggle a large stock of foreign-manufactured cigarettes into the country.

title: Nissan builds the final R35 GT-R after 18 years of production
byline: After 18 years and almost 48,000 units made, Nissan has built the final R35 GT-R at its plant in Tochigi, Japan. The concluding R35 was assembled as a T-Spec and finished in Midnight Purple—a signature color in the GT-R’s history.

title: Driver of tipper truck arrested after three killed in Kuliyapitiya accident
byline: The driver of the tipper truck, which collided head on with a school van in which three persons died in Kuliyapitiya this morning, has been arrested, police stated.

title: Sri Lanka approves action plan to combat illegal fishing in South Asian waters
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal presented by the Minister of Fisheries, Water, and Ocean Resources to sign the regional action plan regarding actions related to illegal, unreported, and unregulated fishing in the region.

title: Two nabbed at BIA with smartphones worth Rs. 100M
byline: Two Sri Lankans have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by Sri Lanka Customs this morning (27), while attempting to smuggle in a large quantity of smartphones valued at Rs. 100 million, without the required approval from the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL).

title: Kpop Demon Hunters becomes Netflix’s most viewed film ever
byline: The animated musical KPop Demon Hunters has climbed “up, up, up” Netflix’s charts to become its most viewed movie ever, the streaming platform says.

title: Another suspect arrested over Kahawatta shooting incident
byline: Another suspect in connection with the Kahawatta shooting incident has been arrested by the Ratnapura Divisional Crime Investigation Bureau, police stated.

title: Special Commodity Levy on potatoes and big onions increased
byline: The Special Commodity Levy on imported potatoes has been increased from Rs. 60 to Rs. 80 per kilogram, the Ministry of Finance said.

title: Ex-President Ranil to remain in ICU for two more days – National Hospital
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe will need to remain in the ICU of the Colombo National Hospital for approximately two more days, as recommended by specialist doctors, according to the Deputy Director, Dr. Rukshan Bellana.

title: Govt to award contract to local company to renovate section of Southern Expressway
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to award the contract to a local company for the renovation of the section of the Southern Expressway between Kottawa and Dodangoda, covering 15 kilometers.

title: SC adjourns consideration of petitions challenging Sri Lanka–India Digital ID MoU
byline: The Supreme Court has ordered that two petitions filed by former Minister Wimal Weerawansa and several others, seeking a ruling to invalidate the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between Sri Lanka and India for the implementation of a project to issue digital identity cards for Sri Lankan citizens..

title: Sri Lanka set to manage public debt using Commonwealth software from next month
byline: Sri Lanka will begin using the Commonwealth Meridian software from next month to manage public debt as part of the economic recovery plan.

title: New methodology introduced for pricing of pharmaceutical drugs
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to a resolution seeking parliamentary approval for regulations issued under the National Medicines Regulatory Authority Act, No. 2 of 2025, relating to the pricing of pharmaceutical drugs.

title: South Korea bans phones in school classrooms nationwide
byline: South Korea has passed a bill banning the use of mobile phones and smart devices during class hours in schools - becoming the latest country to restrict phone use among children and teens.

title: Ex-IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon granted bail
byline: Former Inspector General of Police Deshabandu Tennakoon, who was arrested by the CID, and subsequently remanded, has been granted bail.

title: Special awareness program to be conducted to address mental health problems among youth
byline: A proposal to implement a medium-term project with the objective of educating school children and youth to address mental health problems has been approved by the Cabinet of Ministers.

title: Disciplinary inquiry against National Hospital’s Deputy Director Dr. Bellana
byline: Acting Health Minister Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni says that a disciplinary inquiry is to be initiated against the Deputy Director of the Colombo National Hospital, Dr. Rukshan Bellana...

title: One injured after collision involving five vehicles in Dambulla
byline: A road accident involving five vehicles has been reported along the Colombo–Trincomalee main road in the Pohoran Wewa area in Dambulla.

title: Ex-Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne further remanded
byline: Former Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN), Admiral (Retired) Nishantha Ulugetenne, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), has been further remanded, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Number of skeletal remains uncovered from Chemmani mass grave increases to 166
byline: A total of 166 human skeletal remains have been unearthed thus far from a mass grave located near the Sindhubathi cemetery in Chemmani, Jaffna.

title: President discusses boosting dollar reserves with export sector business leaders
byline: A pre-budget discussion for the year 2026 was held yesterday (26) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake with private sector entrepreneurs in the plantation sector to gather insights and recommendations regarding issues in the export sector.

title: US, India push 10-year defence framework even as ties sour over tariffs
byline: The United States and India put defence at the centre of their virtual 2+2 Intersessional Dialogue on Tuesday, moving toward a new 10-year Framework for the US-India Major Defence Partnership.

title: No objection from any diplomat regarding arrest of ex-President Ranil – Foreign Minister
byline: No diplomat or diplomatic organization raised any objection regarding the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath stated.

title: Probe ordered into unlawful assembly near court before Ranil’s hearing
byline: The court has ordered police to investigate and submit a report regarding the unlawful assembly and the individuals who had behaved in an unruly manner near the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court premises on Tuesday (26) shortly before the hearing of the case...

title: Traffic restricted on Borella road stretch due to risk of sinking
byline: Sri Lanka Police has announced that traffic will be restricted on a stretch of entry road to Colombo from the Devi Balika Roundabout to the D.S. Senanayake Junction in the Borella Police Division.

title: Europeans likely to initiate UN sanctions process on Iran on Thursday, sources say
byline: Britain, France and Germany are likely to begin the process of reimposing U.N. sanctions on Iran on Thursday, but hope Tehran will provide commitments over its nuclear programme within 30 days that will convince them to defer concrete action, four diplomats said.

title: ‘Katchatheevu belongs to Sri Lanka, that will never change’ – FM responds to Vijay
byline: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath today issued a stern response to the controversial comments recently made by Indian actor-turned-politician Vijay regarding the Katchatheevu Island.

title: President briefed on new plans to boost industrial sector’s contribution to national economy
byline: A review of the projects implemented under the 2025 budgetary allocations of the Ministry of Industries and Enterprise Development, together with the pre-budget discussion for the year 2026, was held this morning (27) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: CID probing Gammanpila’s controversial statement, court told
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has informed the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court that an investigation has been initiated under the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR) Act against former Minister Udaya Gammanpila.

title: 11 injured in head-on collision of two buses in Tangalle
byline: A total of eleven people have sustained injuries in a road accident that occurred this evening (27) when two buses collided head-on in the Mahawela area of Tangalle.

title: USS Tulsa makes return to Colombo Port
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka announced the visit of the Independence-variant littoral combat ship USS Tulsa (LCS 16) of the US Navy to the Port of Colombo today (August 27).

title: ‘Every woman and girl must be able to live with dignity and safety’ - PM Harini
byline: The Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya participated in the policy and research forum titled “Unlocking the Gender Dividend: Driving Policy Change Through Knowledge,” hosted by the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) Sri Lanka today (August 27) at Galle Face Hotel.
